title: 旧约 - 约伯记(Job) - 第 31 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 约伯记(Job) -- 第 31 章 ( 本篇共有 42 章 )

lineList.en: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?
lineList.cn: 我与眼睛立约，怎能恋恋瞻望处女呢。

lineList.en: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
lineList.cn: 从至上的神所得之分，从至高全能者所得之业，是什么呢。

lineList.en: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?
lineList.cn: 岂不是祸患临到不义的，灾害临到作孽的呢。

lineList.en: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?
lineList.cn: 神岂不是察看我的道路，数点我的脚步呢。

lineList.en: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;
lineList.cn: 我若与虚谎同行，脚若追随诡诈。

lineList.en: Let me be weighed in an even balance that God may know mine integrity.
lineList.cn: 我若被公道的天平称度，使神可以知道我的纯正。

lineList.en: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;
lineList.cn: 我的脚步若偏离正路，我的心若随着我的眼目，若有玷污粘在我手上。

lineList.en: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.
lineList.cn: 就愿我所种的有别人吃，我田所产的被拔出来。

lineList.en: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour's door;
lineList.cn: 我若受迷惑，向妇人起淫念，在邻舍的门外蹲伏。

lineList.en: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.
lineList.cn: 就愿我的妻子给别人推磨，别人也与她同室。

lineList.en: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
lineList.cn: 因为这是大罪，是审判官当罚的罪孽。

lineList.en: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.
lineList.cn: 这本是火焚烧，直到毁灭，必拔除我所有的家产。

lineList.en: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;
lineList.cn: 我的仆婢与我争辩的时候，我若藐视不听他们的情节。

lineList.en: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
lineList.cn: 神兴起，我怎样行呢。他察问，我怎样回答呢。

lineList.en: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?
lineList.cn: 造我在腹中的，不也是造他吗。将他与我抟在腹中的，岂不是一位吗。

lineList.en: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;
lineList.cn: 我若不容贫寒人得其所愿，或叫寡妇眼中失望，

lineList.en: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;
lineList.cn: 或独自吃我一点食物，孤儿没有与我同吃。

lineList.en: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother's womb;)
lineList.cn: （从幼年时孤儿与我同长，好像父子一样。我从出母腹就扶助寡妇）。（扶助原文作引领）

lineList.en: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;
lineList.cn: 我若见人因无衣死亡，或见穷乏人身无遮盖。

lineList.en: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
lineList.cn: 我若不使他因我羊的毛得暖，为我祝福。

lineList.en: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:
lineList.cn: 我若在城门口见有帮助我的，举手攻击孤儿。

lineList.en: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.
lineList.cn: 情愿我的肩头从缺盆骨脱落，我的膀臂从羊矢骨折断。

lineList.en: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.
lineList.cn: 因神降的灾祸使我恐惧。因他的威严，我不能妄为。

lineList.en: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
lineList.cn: 我若以黄金为指望，对精金说，你是我的倚靠。

lineList.en: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;
lineList.cn: 我若因财物丰裕，因我手多得资财而欢喜。

lineList.en: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;
lineList.cn: 我若见太阳发光，明月行在空中，

lineList.en: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:
lineList.cn: 心就暗暗被引诱，口便亲手。

lineList.en: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.
lineList.cn: 这也是审判官当罚的罪孽，又是我背弃在上的神。

lineList.en: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:
lineList.cn: 我若见恨我的遭报就欢喜，见他遭灾便高兴。

lineList.en: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.
lineList.cn: （我没有容口犯罪，咒诅他的生命）

lineList.en: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.
lineList.cn: 若我帐棚的人未尝说，谁不以主人的食物吃饱呢。

lineList.en: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.
lineList.cn: （从来我没有容客旅在街上住宿，却开门迎接行路的人）

lineList.en: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:
lineList.cn: 我若像亚当（或作别人）遮掩我的过犯，将罪孽藏在怀中。

lineList.en: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?
lineList.cn: 因惧怕大众，又因宗族藐视我使我惊恐，以致闭口无言，杜门不出。

lineList.en: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.
lineList.cn: 惟愿有一位肯听我。（看哪，在这里有我所划的押，愿全能者回答我）

lineList.en: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.
lineList.cn: 愿那敌我者，所写的状词在我这里，我必带在肩上，又绑在头上为冠冕。

lineList.en: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.
lineList.cn: 我必向他述说我脚步的数目，必如君王进到他面前。

lineList.en: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;
lineList.cn: 我若夺取田地，这地向我喊冤，犁沟一同哭泣。

lineList.en: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:
lineList.cn: 我若吃地的出产不给价值，或叫原主丧命。

lineList.en: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
lineList.cn: 愿这地长蒺藜代替麦子，长恶草代替大麦。约伯的话说完了。
